note.p: Birth: Duke Street, Westminster, London, England (26 March 1803)
Death: High Elms, near Farnborough, Hampshire (20 June 1865)
Education: Eton; Trinity College, Cambridge. BA (1825); MA (1833)

Career: Partner in his father's bank, Lubbock and Co (1825); first Vice-Chancellor, London University (1837-1842); sole working partner in the bank (1840-1860); a Treasurer of the Great Exhibition (1851); bank joined with another to become Roberts, Lubbock and Co (1860); died of valvular disease of the heart
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1866-1867 vol 15 pp xxxii-xxxvii
References: H G Lyons, 'The Society's First Bequest' in NR 1939 vol 2 pp 43-46
